alert.note: Alert for Banner; Box Butte; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 3:56PM CST until February 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 or more inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...The western Nebraska panhandle, and portions of southeast Wyoming along and east of Interstate 25. This includes the cities of Cheyenne, Wheatland, Douglas, Lusk, and Torrington in Wyoming, and the cities of Chadron, Alliance, Scottsbluff, and Kimball in Nebraska. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero Wednesday through early Thursday could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Box Butte; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux
